channel.title: Lectures on MATH3411 Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Lectures on MATH3411 Musings

item.title: Lecture 01
item.description: Digital Data Transmission (as Maths) Source Alphabet - S = {s1, s1, …, sq} of q symbols Code Alphabet A, consisting of r symbols The radix r is the number of symbols in the code alphabet Probabilities p_i = P(S_i) A code that encodes each symbol s_i by a codeword (string of code symbols) Codewords can be seen as vectors.
